prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in engineering would.
problem_prompt:
Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in engineering would. A square loop of side length 8.0 m is carrying a current of 3 A. What is the magnetic field at the center of the loop? Additionally, please select the option from the given choices that you believe is closest to the correct answer! (Please note that the following content involves constants might be used in the calculations : \mu_0 = 1.26 * 10^(-6) V·s/(A·m)

A. 5.44 x 10^(-7) Tesla
B. 5.93 x 10^(-7) Tesla
C. 2.12 x 10^(-7) Tesla
D. 6.41 x 10^(-7) Tesla

Answer:
